description: Bearish reversal pattern featuring three peaks at approximately the same price level. Forms after an uptrend and indicates strong resistance that price cannot break through, signaling potential trend reversal.
validationRules: Must form after a clear uptrend
Three distinct peaks at roughly the same level (within 2-3%)
Support line connects the two troughs between peaks
Each peak should show rejection with volume
Breakout below support line confirms the pattern
Volume typically decreases on 2nd and 3rd peaks, increases on breakdown
invalidationSignals: Price breaks above the resistance level (peaks)
Fourth peak forms - pattern becomes consolidation
Volume increases on 2nd or 3rd peak (buyers still active)
Pattern takes longer than 3 months (loses reliability)
commonMistakes: Expecting perfect symmetry - peaks can vary slightly
Not waiting for retest of broken support as resistance
Ignoring volume - should decrease on later peaks
Trading pattern in sideways consolidation vs clear uptrend

tradeSetup.entry: Breakdown below support line with volume, or retest of broken support as resistance
tradeSetup.stopLoss: Above the most recent peak or above all three peaks for conservative approach
tradeSetup.target: Measured move: height of pattern projected downward from breakdown point

supportive: RSI showing bearish divergence at the peaks
Volume spike on support breakdown (1.5x+ average)
Moving averages starting to roll over
conflicting: Major support level just below support line

confluenceFactors: Peaks align with major resistance level
Multiple timeframe confirmation (visible on daily and weekly)
